content: e p d asy as ie ishcloth by emily williams this classic pattern is a great way to learn short row or kniting backward knit two out of one ball of sugar n cream or - my favorite - one of these and one of grandma marian s dishcloth materials vital stats yarn gauge approximately 40 yards/37 meters worsted weight approximately 20 stitches = 4 /10 cm in garter stitch yarn shown in sugar n cream colorways key lime gauge is not critical but it will impact yarn usage and pie mango madness and over the rainbow front finished measurements page top front page bottom and below respectively finished measurements needles diameter = approximately 6 /15 cm us #6/4 mm 24 /60 cm or size to get gauge for working flat skill level intermediate short row grafting or seaming notions tapestry needle waste yarn optional construction / notes seven short row wedges connect to make a circular cloth - like pieces of pie if you haven t worked short row before don t over-think it just turn the work at the end of every row and press onward for a larger or smaller cloth cast on more or fewer stitches each extra stitch cast on will add roughly 4 / 1 cm remember that each additional stitch cast on adds 14 extra increasingly-long row - judge yardage accordingly cotton is tough on your hands relax and keep a loose gauge even if it means a smaller needle to get gauge instructions cast on wedges 2-7 for a seamless cloth cast on 15 stitches using waste repeat wedge 1 to make 6 more wedges on the 7th yarn switch to main yarn for rest of cloth or - if and final wedge omit the final row row 28 you don t mind a seam - cast on 15 stitches normally using method of your choice finishing if you began by casting on to waste yarn transfer held wedge 1 stitches to a spare needle and discard waste yarn keep row 1 wrong side & all wrong side row - slip 1 an eye on the inner most stitch which is actually from stitch knitwise with yarn in back knit to end wedge 2 cut working yarn leaving a generous tail row 2 right side - knit 14 use tail to graft edges together weave in all ends row 4 - 26 - continue working one less stitch each right side row until you finally knit just 2 stitches or - if you cast on normally - bind off then cut yarn row 27 - slip 1 stitch knitwise with yarn in back k1 leaving a generous tail use tail to seam edges together row 28 - knit 15 weave in all ends please respect designers and copyright while free this pattern is for personal use only do not distribute copy or use for commercial purposes easy as pie dishcloth - page 2 of 2 version 1/23/2024
